search_parameters.q: Variations on the Theme of Primary Groups: Forms of Social Control Within School Staffs Warren, Donald I. Sociology of Education

search_information.query_displayed: Variations on the Theme of Primary Groups: Forms of Social Control Within School Staffs Warren, Donald I. Sociology of Education

organic_results.title: Variations on the theme of primary groups: forms of social control within school staffs
organic_results.snippet: Four mechanisms of social control are analyzed in relationship to a typology of school staffs which in several respects resemble primary groups. Mechanisms of selective recruitment and selective expulsion are used extensively by staffs whose members internalize and share values. The mechanism of socialization is important in a school staff with a heterogeneous membership when the members interact informally away from the work setting. Isolation is employed to punish deviants in a staff whose members interact frequently …

publication_info.summary: DI Warren - Sociology of Education, 1970 - JSTOR
